content.query:
-- This is auto-generated code
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        -- you can use abfss protocol as well
        -- 'abfss://<container-name>@<storage-account-name>.dfs.core.windows.net/<folder>/<file>'
        BULK 'https://synapsedatalakeadls2.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        -- Two version of Parser Available, Recommended to use 2.0
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',' -- column separator
    ) AS [result]


-- Explore Data Types is used within our command.
-- Default for Strings is VARCHAR(8000) - This is too big dtype, It is costly and slow.
EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N' SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ''https://synapsedatalakeadls2.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv'',
        FORMAT = ''CSV'',
        PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0'',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        ROWTERMINATOR = ''\n''
    ) AS [result]
'


-- Investigave Max Column Length 
SELECT
    MAX(LEN(LocationId)) as LocationId,
    MAX(LEN(Borough)) as Len_Borogh,
    MAX(LEN(Zone)) as Zone
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsedatalakeadls2.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS [result]




-- Manually Specify the column
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsedatalakeadls2.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH(
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    )
    AS [result]

-- DEfault Collation SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS 
-- It is not a UTF8 Collation.
-- Above Code Column Names Matter because Default Collation is Case Sensitive.
-- You can change the default collation

SELECT name, collation_name FROM sys.databases


-- Changing Collation 
-- We should keep UTF8 Collation, it is good for String Types

-- Specify Collation within Column Level, Warning will disappear
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsedatalakeadls2.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH(
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8,
        Zone VARCHAR(50) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8
    )
    AS [result]



-- Apply collation Database Level
-- Only can alter your database. You cannot Alter the master database.

CREATE DATABASE nyc_taxi_discovery
USE nyc_taxi_discovery

ALTER DATABASE nyc_taxi_discovery COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8

SELECT name, collation_name FROM sys.databases


SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsedatalakeadls2.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH(
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    )
    AS [result]



-- Reading file with no header

SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsedatalakeadls2.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone_without_header.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    -- Column order is Matter.
    WITH(
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    )
    AS [result]


-- SELECTING Only Some Columns, Not All the Columns.
-- If Column Names Are Specified in the File, you can select only the column names for some columns.
-- Not Necessary to select all the columns
-- But if Column Name are not specified within the File. If you select only some columns. It will not know
-- It will pick just because of their number

-- For that we should specify the COlumn Order if we want to select only some columns from the file
-- where column names are not specified.

SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsedatalakeadls2.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone_without_header.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    -- Column order is Matter.
    WITH(
        Borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
        LocationID SMALLINT 1
    )
    AS [result]


-- Change Column Names
-- We should Specify the Column Orders
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsedatalakeadls2.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        -- You can specify HEADER_ROW = TRUE in this case as well, but FIRSTROW = 2 is better
        -- Because We are using our custom Column Names.
        FIRSTROW = 2,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    -- Column order is Matter.
    WITH(
        LocationID SMALLINT 1 ,
        Borough VARCHAR(15) 2 ,
        Zone VARCHAR(50) 3 ,
       -- service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
        ServiceZone VARCHAR(15) 4

    )
    AS [result]



--If you get an error and you see that you don't get a good error message in console
-- Microsoft offer to change PARSER_VERSION = '1.0' in that case. It will give you better understanding
-- WHy error Happened or Query did not work.



-- EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE
-- You should create it under your database, you cannot create in master database.
/*
CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE <data_source_name> 
WITH (
    LOCATION = <'abfss://<container-name>@<storage-account-name>.dfs.core.windows.net/'

)

*/

USE nyc_taxi_discovery;

CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data
WITH (
    LOCATION = 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsedatalakeadls2.dfs.core.windows.net/'
)



SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        -- We have Alrready Created a External Data Source
        -- Therefore we don't need to specify entire URL in BULK.
        BULK '/raw/taxi_zone_without_header.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    -- Column order is Matter.
    WITH(
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    )
    AS [result]



CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data_raw
WITH (
    LOCATION = 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsedatalakeadls2.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/'
)



SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'taxi_zone_without_header.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    -- Column order is Matter.
    WITH(
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    )
    AS [result]

-- Dropping Data Source
DROP EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data;

-- Look which External Data source point to which FOLDER.
SELECT name, location
FROM sys.external_data_sources
